metadata.title: CVE-2015-1253 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
core/html/parser/HTMLConstructionSite.cpp in the DOM implementation inBlink, as used in Google Chrome before 43.0.2357.65, allows remoteattackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy via crafted JavaScript code thatappends a child to a SCRIPT element, related to the insert andexecuteReparentTask functions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1253` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-browser-l10n - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-chromedriver - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.7.8-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.7.8-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.7.8-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.7.8-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.7.8-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.7.8-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.7.8-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.7.8-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
